Asterism/Constellation: Alpha (Hamal), Beta (Sheratan), and Gamma in Arietis
Notes (Activities, Sayings, Status): People get wet with the first rains for good luck. Winds weak after initial storm.

Asterism/Constellation: Musca Borealis in Arietis
Notes (Activities, Sayings, Status): Ushers in with a storm, calm after. Agricultural activity: allowing chopped trees to dry before burning; seeds sown on some islands.

Asterism/Constellation: Pleiades in Taurus
Notes (Activities, Sayings, Status): Weather for HULHAGU (South-West Monsoon) firmly settled. Old saying: seven storms in this NAKAIY. Stormy days of HULHAGU begin. Dried leaves burnt, ashes spread, fields sown.

Asterism/Constellation: Alpha, Theta, Gamma, Delta and Epsilon in Tauri
Notes (Activities, Sayings, Status): Generally stormy with strong winds and rough seas. Fields sown on some islands.

Asterism/Constellation: Lambda, Phi (one) and Phi (two) in Orionis
Notes (Activities, Sayings, Status): Stormy with rough seas. Fields are sown and weeding is carried out.

Asterism/Constellation: Alpha (Betelgeuse) in Orionis
Notes (Activities, Sayings, Status): Sea travellers try to steer towards the middle of storm clouds. Weeding, thinning, gap-filling and transplanting of fields are done.

Asterism/Constellation: Alpha (Castor), and Beta (Pollux) in Geminorum
Notes (Activities, Sayings, Status): Stormy NAKAIY with rough seas. Sudden gusts of wind frequent. Weeding, thinning, gap-filling and transplanting of fields are done.

Figure/Symbol: Crescent or the barbed head of an arrow
Asterism/Constellation: Theta, Delta, and Gamma in Cancri
Notes (Activities, Sayings, Status): Rainy and skies are overcast most of the time.

Asterism/Constellation: Eta, Sigma, Delta, Epsilon and Rho in Hydrae
Notes (Activities, Sayings, Status): Stormy days of HULHAGU begin to close; generally calm. Grain harvest is reaped.

Asterism/Constellation: Alpha (Regulus), Zeta, Gamma (Algeiba), Mu, Epsilon and Eta in Leonis
Notes (Activities, Sayings, Status): Generally calm, but old saying: if Ahuliha was stormy, Maa is likely to be stormy too. Harvesting of the fields is done.

Asterism/Constellation: Delta and Theta in Leonis
Notes (Activities, Sayings, Status): End of the rainy days of HULHAGU; isolated showers may occur. Harvesting of the fields is done.

Asterism/Constellation: Beta (Denebola) in Leonis
Notes (Activities, Sayings, Status): In the time of sailing vessels, this was the time they left for Bengal and other trading centres.

Asterism/Constellation: Alpha, Beta, Gamma, Delta and Epsilon in Corvi
Notes (Activities, Sayings, Status): Generally clear and calm, with minor storms now and then.

Asterism/Constellation: Alpha (Spica) in Virginis
Notes (Activities, Sayings, Status): Winds generally weak; isolated short showers. Some sailors leave for Colombo and other ports of Sri Lanka.

Figure/Symbol: Coral bead, a gem or a pearl
Asterism/Constellation: Alpha (Arcturus) in Bootis
Notes (Activities, Sayings, Status): Fishing is good and fish caught are generally large. Winds may not settle on one direction.

Asterism/Constellation: Alpha, Beta, Gamma and Iota in Librae
Notes (Activities, Sayings, Status): Calm and fishing is good ("noraahi" fishing days).

Asterism/Constellation: Beta, Delta, and Pi in Scorpionis
Notes (Activities, Sayings, Status): Winds will be weak. Old saying: if the first storm comes from the east, fishing will be generally good. North-East Monsoon currents start on the third day.

Asterism/Constellation: Alpha (Antares), Sigma and Tau in Scorpionis
Notes (Activities, Sayings, Status): Fishing is generally good. Winds will be generally weak.

Asterism/Constellation: Epsilon, Mu, Xi, Eta, Theta, Iota, Chi, Upsilon and Lambda (Shaula) in Scopionis
Notes (Activities, Sayings, Status): Winds strong and unsettled; seas rough. "Tadi helun" ceremony on the third day. Good bait for fishing in northern Maldives.

Asterism/Constellation: Delta and Epsilon (Kaus Australis) in Sagittarii
Notes (Activities, Sayings, Status): Winds strong; seas rough. Good fishing season in the northern Maldives.

Asterism/Constellation: Sigma (Nunki), and Zeta in Sagittarii
Notes (Activities, Sayings, Status): Winds strong; seas rough.

Arab Lunar Mansion (Name & Meaning): Sa'd Bula ("felicity of a devourer") or Al-Bula ("the devourer")
Asterism/Constellation: Alpha (Altair), Beta and Gamma in Aquilae
Notes (Activities, Sayings, Status): Seas calm, winds moderate. Fishing is good on the eastern side of the Maldives.

Asterism/Constellation: Alpha, Beta, Gamma and Delta in Delphini
Notes (Activities, Sayings, Status): Seas moderate. In the past, sailing vessels left Maldives for Cochin and other ports in the area.

Hindu Lunar Mansion (Name & Meaning): Catabhishaj or Catabhisha ("having a hundred physicians")
Asterism/Constellation: Lambda in Aquarii
Notes (Activities, Sayings, Status): Seas calm, currents moderate.

Arab Lunar Mansion (Name & Meaning): Al-Fargh al-Mukdim ("the fore spout of the water-jar")
Asterism/Constellation: Alpha (Markab), Beta (Scheat), in Pegasi
Notes (Activities, Sayings, Status): Thunder and lightning may be frequent. Magoo, Uni, Dhakdhaa and similar plants are cut down in fields to dry before burning.

Arab Lunar Mansion (Name & Meaning): Al-Fargh al-Mukhir ("the hind spout of the water-jar")
Asterism/Constellation: Gamma (Algenib) in Pegasi and Alpha (Alpheratz) in Andromedae
Notes (Activities, Sayings, Status): Storm associated with its name is normally experienced on the third or fourth day. Thunder and lightning may be experienced; frequent thundering is said to mean good yam harvest.

Asterism/Constellation: Xi in Pisc.
Notes (Activities, Sayings, Status): The storm associated with its name, if at night, will be severe. Fishing generally good in the northern atolls. Mirihi cut down in fields to dry before burning.

Asterism/Constellation: Vega (Alpha), Epsilon and Zeta in Lyrae
Notes (Activities, Sayings, Status): NAKAIY is no longer in use. It was an interpolation in the archaic system to correct the calendar; 3 days reduced annually, full 12-day NAKAIY every fourth year, placed before HUVAN and after UTHURAHALHA.
